snippet: The proposal, which has been scaled back several times in recent months, heads to the full Council, where approval is now expected.
abstract: New York City Council's Land Use Committee votes, 19 to 1, to approve New York University's plan to expand its campus in Greenwich Village; the full Council is scheduled to vote on the plan, and critics of the project express hope that they can still derail it.
lead_paragraph: The proposal, which has been scaled back several times in recent months, heads to the full Council, where approval is now expected.

headline.seo: N.Y.U. Expansion Plan in Greenwich Village Wins Key Council Vote
headline.main: N.Y.U. Expansion Plan Wins Key Council Panel Vote
headline.print_headline: N.Y.U. Expansion Plan Wins Key Council Panel Vote
